Get number of blocks currently in model

Source: R/model__n_blocks.R
n_blocks.Rd

Returns the number of blocks/clusters in the current model state.

n_blocks(sbm)

Arguments

sbm

Object of class sbm_network.

Value

Number of clusters in current model state

See also

Other modeling: choose_best_collapse_state(), collapse_blocks(), collapse_run(), entropy(), get_block_edge_counts(), get_state(), mcmc_sweep()

Examples


# Small edge list to build network
edges <- dplyr::tribble(
  ~from, ~to,
  "a1"   , "b1"   ,
  "a1"   , "b2"   ,
  "a1"   , "b3"   ,
  "a2"   , "b1"   ,
  "a2"   , "b4"   ,
  "a3"   , "b1"
)

# A small simulated network with no blocks
net <- new_sbm_network(edges)

n_blocks(net)
#> [1] 0

# Add some two random blocks
net %>% initialize_blocks(2) %>% n_blocks()
#> [1] 2

# Add a block per node
net %>% initialize_blocks() %>% n_blocks()
#> [1] 2
